message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public class CustomIterator implements Iterator<Object> {
    private int count = 0;
    private Object currentKey = null;
    private Iterator<Map.Entry<Object, Integer>> mapIterator;

    public CustomIterator(Map<Object, Integer> map) {
        this.mapIterator = map.entrySet().iterator();
        this.moveToNextKey();
    }

    private void moveToNextKey() {
        if (mapIterator.hasNext()) {
            Map.Entry<Object, Integer> entry = mapIterator.next();
            currentKey = entry.getKey();
            count = entry.getValue();
        } else {
            currentKey = null;
        }
    }

    @Override
    public boolean hasNext() {
        return currentKey != null;
    }

    @Override
    public Object next() {
        if (!hasNext()) {
            throw new NoSuchElementException();
        }
        count--;
        Object key = currentKey;
        if (count == 0) {
            moveToNextKey();
        }
        return key;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This custom iterator will iterate over each key in the map the number of times specified by its value. It uses a map iterator to move between keys, and a count variable to keep track of how many times the current key should be returned. When the count reaches zero, it moves to the next key.
